translation.title: The Simile of the Fire Sticks

segments.en: Linked Discourses 48
4. The Pleasure Faculty
39. The Simile of the Fire Sticks
“Mendicants, there are these five faculties.
What five?
The faculties of pleasure, pain, happiness, sadness, and equanimity.

segments.pli: Sukhavedaniyaṃ, bhikkhave, phassaṃ paṭicca uppajjati sukhindriyaṃ.
segments.en: The faculty of pleasure arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as pleasant.
When in a state of pleasure, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of pleasure.’

segments.pli: Tasseva sukhavedaniyassa phassassa nirodhā ‘yaṃ tajjaṃ vedayitaṃ sukhavedaniyaṃ phassaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ sukhindriyaṃ taṃ nirujjhati, taṃ vūpasammatī’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as pleasant, you understand that the corresponding faculty of pleasure ceases and stops.

segments.pli: Dukkhavedaniyaṃ, bhikkhave, phassaṃ paṭicca uppajjati dukkhindriyaṃ.
segments.en: The faculty of pain arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as painful.
When in a state of pain, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of pain.’

segments.pli: Tasseva dukkhavedaniyassa phassassa nirodhā ‘yaṃ tajjaṃ vedayitaṃ dukkhavedaniyaṃ phassaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ dukkhindriyaṃ taṃ nirujjhati, taṃ vūpasammatī’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as painful, you understand that the corresponding faculty of pain ceases and stops.

segments.pli: Somanassavedaniyaṃ, bhikkhave, phassaṃ paṭicca uppajjati somanassindriyaṃ.
segments.en: The faculty of happiness arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as happiness.
When in a state of happiness, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of happiness.’

segments.pli: Tasseva somanassavedaniyassa phassassa nirodhā ‘yaṃ tajjaṃ vedayitaṃ somanassavedaniyaṃ phassaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ somanassindriyaṃ taṃ nirujjhati, taṃ vūpasammatī’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as happiness, you understand that the corresponding faculty of happiness ceases and stops.

segments.pli: Domanassavedaniyaṃ, bhikkhave, phassaṃ paṭicca uppajjati domanassindriyaṃ.
segments.en: The faculty of sadness arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as sadness.
When in a state of sadness, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of sadness.’

segments.pli: Tasseva domanassavedaniyassa phassassa nirodhā ‘yaṃ tajjaṃ vedayitaṃ domanassavedaniyaṃ phassaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ domanassindriyaṃ taṃ nirujjhati, taṃ vūpasammatī’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as sadness, you understand that the corresponding faculty of sadness ceases and stops.

segments.pli: Upekkhāvedaniyaṃ, bhikkhave, phassaṃ paṭicca uppajjati upekkhindriyaṃ.
segments.en: The faculty of equanimity arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as equanimous.
When in a state of equanimity, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of equanimity.’

segments.pli: Tasseva upekkhāvedaniyassa phassassa nirodhā ‘yaṃ tajjaṃ vedayitaṃ upekkhāvedaniyaṃ phassaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ upekkhindriyaṃ taṃ nirujjhati, taṃ vūpasammatī’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as equanimous, you understand that the corresponding faculty of equanimity ceases and stops.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ kaṭṭhānaṃ saṅghaṭṭanasamodhānā usmā jāyati, tejo abhinibbattati; tesaṃyeva kaṭṭhānaṃ nānābhāvāvinikkhepā yā tajjā usmā sā nirujjhati sā vūpasammati;
segments.en: When you rub two sticks together, heat is generated and fire is produced. But when you part the sticks and lay them aside, any corresponding heat ceases and stops.

segments.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, sukhavedaniyaṃ phassaṃ paṭicca uppajjati sukhindriyaṃ.
segments.en: In the same way, the faculty of pleasure arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as pleasant.
When in a state of pleasure, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of pleasure.’

segments.pli: Tasseva sukhavedaniyassa phassassa nirodhā ‘yaṃ tajjaṃ vedayitaṃ sukhavedaniyaṃ phassaṃ paṭicca uppajjati sukhindriyaṃ taṃ nirujjhati, taṃ vūpasammatī’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as pleasant, you understand that the corresponding faculty of pleasure ceases and stops.
The faculty of pain …
happiness …
sadness …

segments.pli: upekkhāvedaniyaṃ, bhikkhave, phassaṃ paṭicca uppajjati upekkhindriyaṃ.
segments.en: equanimity arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as equanimous.
When in a state of equanimity, you understand: ‘I’m in a state of equanimity.’

segments.pli: Tasseva upekkhāvedaniyassa phassassa nirodhā ‘yaṃ tajjaṃ vedayitaṃ upekkhāvedaniyaṃ phassaṃ paṭicca uppajjati upekkhindriyaṃ taṃ nirujjhati, taṃ vūpasammatī’ti pajānāti”.
segments.en: With the cessation of that contact to be experienced as equanimous, you understand that the corresponding faculty of equanimity ceases and stops.”

suttaplex.blurb: The five faculties of pleasure, pain, happiness, sadness, and equanimity arise dependent on the appropriate contact, like sticks making fire.
